meanings.definition: A stone or wooden slab, generally taller than it is wide, erected as a monument.
meanings.sent1: The ancient civilization placed steles to honor their leaders.
meanings.sent2: Visitors to the museum admired the intricate designs on the steles.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel climbed the steles in the park, pretending to be a giant.
meanings.sent4: The steles in the graveyard stood like silent guardians over the resting souls.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight cast long shadows behind the steles, creating a solemn atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A vertical stone or wooden slab with an inscribed or sculptured surface, used as a monument or grave marker.
meanings.sent1: The ancient civilization carved stories on the steles to preserve their history.
meanings.sent2: Families gathered around the steles to pay their respects to the departed.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to bury its acorn next to the steles, thinking it was a tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: The steles in the cemetery whispered tales of the past to those who listened closely.
meanings.sent5: The moonlight illuminated the intricate details of the steles, making them seem almost alive.
